title: Shocking moment mass brawl breaks out at college as teachers try to split up students
text:
Shocking moment mass brawl breaks out at college as teachers try to split up students Seven students at Hopwood Hall College in Middleton have been suspended and one permanently excluded Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
This is the shocking moment a mass brawl between students broke out in a college corridor. 
Seven students have been suspended and another permanently excluded after the fight took place at Hopwood Hall College ’s Middleton campus on February 2. 
College bosses said security staff immediately tried to break up the fight and police were called. 
In the clip - which the M.E.N. has pixellated for legal reasons - two teenagers, thought to be aged between 16 and 18-years-old, can be seen squaring up to each other. 
The two students exchange words and begin arguing, before punches are thrown. Mass brawl in corridor at Hopwood Hall College in Middleton (Photo: Facebook) 
Some other students begin to join in the fight, while others film the punch-up on their mobile phones, and others just watch on. Read More 
One student can be seen placing another in a headlock, as others throw punches and kicks at each other. 
Another teenager can be heard screaming “What the f**k are you touching me for?” 
A teacher is then seen rushing to the centre of the fight and attempting to break it up. 
In the clip, the teacher can be heard shouting “Stop” and “Back off”, but the students ignore him and continue to brawl. A teacher tries to break up a mass brawl at Hopwood Hall College in Middleton (Photo: Facebook) 
The clip has been shared on social media websites and has been viewed by more than 105,000 people on Facebook. Read More Latest on devastating fire that destroyed church 
A spokesman for Hopwood Hall College said police were called shortly after the incident and an investigation has been launched. 
The spokesman said: “Hopwood Hall College can confirm there was an incident involving students at the Middleton campus on the February 2, 2017. Mass brawl in corridor at Hopwood Hall College in Middleton (Photo: Facebook) 
“Although it was an isolated incident, it is being fully investigated by Greater Manchester Police and seven learners who were involved have been suspended whilst the matter is investigated internally pending disciplinary action. Another learner has been excluded permanently. 
“Incidents of this nature are extremely rare in our college and the message has been clearly communicated to learners that it is totally unacceptable for anyone to be involved in or incite any behaviour of this kind. Mass brawl in corridor at Hopwood Hall College in Middleton (Photo: Facebook) 
“Hopwood Hall College is committed to continuing to provide a safe environment for our learners and staff. Our security team were immediately at the scene of the incident and dealt with the incident swiftly and appropriately. 
“We regret that the actions of a handful of individuals may tarnish the excellent reputation both students and staff have built together, a reputation that was recently justified after Ofsted rated the college as Good.” Like us on Facebook
